PRESIDENT
SEYMOUR N. SIEGEL
WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7. N. Y.
February 7th, 1952
Mr* Graydan Ausmus
WUOA
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydan*
1 have your note of February 5th concerning the NAEB
luncheon at Columbus* You will remember that last year Harry
Skornia made -the program arrangements* It would seem to me -that
if you called Bill Harley he could make certain speakers, among
our consultants, available if we needed such. In any event, I
would like to leave the entire operation up to you, since the
chances are better than even that I will not be in Columbus this
year. You might appoint anyone else to assist you in the physical
arrangements, etc., and you can use my name if you wish in asking
for such appointments.
The Executive Committee is expected to meet in Urbana
an Friday, February 15th, at approximately 10*00 a*m.
Jim Miles has made reservations for you. Burton and
myself at the Urbana-Lin coin Hotel, and you should have received
tax exemption certificates and travel Vouchers from him.
DIRECTOR OF STUDIES
DALLAS W. SMYTHE
Illinois University Communica¬
tions Research Institute.
Urbana, Illinois
SECRETARY AND
PUBLICATIONS EDITOR
BURTON PAULU
KUOM, U. of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Representing non-commercial, educational, radio and television stations, workshops, and production
centers, owned and operated by colleges, universities, school systems and public-service agencies.
